title: Redesign homepage (docs/index.md) with hero section and card layouts
description:
**As a** documentation visitor
**I want** an engaging, beautiful homepage that clearly showcases Consoul's three main use cases
**So that** I can quickly understand what Consoul offers and get started immediately

**Context:**
The current docs/index.md is text-heavy and doesn't differentiate between the three distinct Consoul products: TUI (Terminal UI), CLI (Command-line chat), and SDK (Python integration). Research of top documentation sites reveals common patterns:

**Reference Analysis (.local repos):**
- **AWS Copilot CLI** (.local/copilot-cli): Uses minimal, clean hero with clear value prop, white primary color, custom icons
- **MkDocs Material** (.local/mkdocs-material/docs/index.md): Uses custom template (`template: home.html`) with card grids, minimal markdown content
- **Typer** (.local/typer): Black/teal theme, termynal.js for animated terminal examples, clean sections

**Key Patterns Identified:**
1. Custom homepage template (not plain markdown)
2. Hero section with gradient backgrounds
3. Card-based feature showcase (3-column grids)
4. Prominent CTA buttons ("Get Started")
5. Screenshot/demo integration
6. Clear product differentiation

**Technical Notes:**
- Current: docs/index.md (146 lines, plain markdown)
- Current theme: docs/assets/css/consoul.css has gradient variables defined
- Available screenshots: docs/assets/screenshots/ (20+ files including themes, modals, conversations)
- MkDocs Material supports custom templates via theme.custom_dir
- Reference: .local/mkdocs-material/material/overrides/home.html

**Files to Modify:**
- docs/index.md - Complete rewrite with custom sections
- mkdocs.yml - Add custom_dir if using template approach
- docs/assets/css/consoul.css - Hero section styles (already has gradients defined)

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** I visit the Consoul documentation homepage
**When** the page loads
**Then** I see a hero section with:
  - Clear tagline emphasizing AI-powered terminal assistant
  - Gradient background using --consoul-gradient-primary
  - Prominent "Get Started" and "View on GitHub" CTA buttons
  - Hero screenshot of TUI in action

**Given** I scroll below the hero
**When** I view the product showcase
**Then** I see a 3-column card grid with:
  - "Consoul TUI" card with icon, description, key features, link
  - "Consoul CLI" card with icon, description, key features, link
  - "Consoul SDK" card with icon, description, key features, link

**Given** I continue scrolling
**When** I view the features section
**Then** I see feature highlights with:
  - Icons from Material Design (pymdownx.emoji already configured)
  - Grid layout (2-3 columns)
  - Features: Multi-Provider, Tool Calling, Code Search, Image Analysis, File Editing
  - Each with brief description and visual indicator

**Given** I'm on mobile (< 768px width)
**When** I view the homepage
**Then** cards stack vertically and all content is readable

**Testing Considerations:**
- Visual regression testing with screenshots
- Mobile responsiveness testing (375px, 768px, 1024px, 1440px)
- Test in both light and dark themes
- Verify all CTA links work
- Check gradient rendering in different browsers
- Ensure glightbox works for screenshot modal

**Implementation Hints:**
1. **Option A - Custom Template** (like MkDocs Material):
   - Create docs/overrides/home.html
   - Set `theme.custom_dir: docs/overrides` in mkdocs.yml
   - Use Jinja2 with MkDocs context
   - Reference: .local/mkdocs-material/material/overrides/home.html

2. **Option B - Enhanced Markdown** (simpler):
   - Use attr_list + md_in_html (already enabled)
   - Create card structure with HTML/CSS classes
   - Reference: .local/typer/docs/index.md for patterns

3. **Recommended**: Start with Option B, migrate to Option A if needed

```markdown
# Hero Section
- Tagline: "AI-Powered Terminal Assistant"
- Subtitle: "Beautiful TUI, Powerful CLI, Flexible SDK"
- CTA: Get Started | View GitHub | Live Demo
```
